alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 15 at 5:49PM EDT until July 15 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Monmouth County in central New Jersey... Northeastern Middlesex County in northern New Jersey... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 549 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Sayreville, or near Perth Amboy, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Perth Amboy, Middletown, Old Bridge, East Brunswick, Sayreville, Carteret, Matawan, Brownville, Navesink, Lincroft, Woodbridge, South River, Metuchen, Keyport, Rumson, Madison Park, Iselin, Sewaren, Port Reading and Strathmore. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 11 and 13. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 1. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 114 and 131. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
